channel.title: CiTR -- Shake a Tail Feather
channel.description: The finest in classic soul and rhythm & blues from the late-50s to the early-70s. Including lesser known artists, regional hits, lost soul gems and contemporary artists recording in that classic soul style. Fridays 10pm to Midnight.
channel.itunes:summary: The finest in classic soul and rhythm & blues from the late-50s to the early-70s. Including lesser known artists, regional hits, lost soul gems and contemporary artists recording in that classic soul style. Fridays 10pm to Midnight.
channel.itunes:author: CiTR 101.9 Vancouver
channel.itunes:subtitle: classic soul and rhythm & blues

item.title: Shake a Tail Feather [fill-in] - "Fueled by moxie & caffeine" (2009 April 03)
item.description:
gak fills in for Jason once again, with an expanded version of his last appearance back during the CITR Fund Drive: a soul primer, showing R&B's roots dating back from the thirties up until today.
Songs:
Lee Dorsey: Yes We Can (Funky as I Can Be!, 2007) Great American Music Cab Calloway: The Man from Harlem (Dance Crazy: from the Charleston to the Jive, 1932) Past Perfect Billy Holliday with Teddy Wilson and his Orchestra: Miss Brown to You (Complete on Columbia v.1, 1935) Columbia/Decca Wynonie Harris: Who Threw the Whiskey in the Well? (Rockin' the Blues, 1944) Proper Box Fairfield Four: Don't Let Nobody Turn You Around (Standing in the Safety Zone, 1947) Dot Jackson Gospel Singers: Heaven Bound Train (Heaven Bound Train: Southern Gospel, 1949) P-Vine Mildred Cummings: Rock Me to Sleep (The Chronological Little Miss Cornshucks, 1951) Classics R&B B. B. King: Whole Lot of Love (RPM 416 7", 1954) Ray Charles: What'd I Say, Parts 1 & 2 (Atlantic Soul: 1959-1975, 1959) Atlantic The Sweet Inspirations: (Gotta Find) A Brand New Love, Pt. I (Atlantic Soul: 1959-1975, 1959) Atlantic Etta James: A Sunday Kind of Love (At Last!, 1961) Chess Doris Troy: Just One Look (Atlantic Soul: 1959-1975, 1963) Atlantic Eddie & Ernie: That's the Way It Is (Time Waits For No One 7", 1964) Tomorrow/Eastern Sam Cooke: A Change is Gonna Come (Ain't That Good News, 1964) ABKCO Aretha Franklin: I Never Loved a Man (The Way I Love You) (I Never Loved a Man the Way I Love You, 1967) Atlantic G. L. Crockett: It's a Man Down There (It's a Man Down There, 1965) Four Brothers Rose Batiste: Hit & Run (I Miss My Baby 7", 1966) Revilot Classics IV: Spooky (Classics IV, 1967) Imperial Dee Dee Warwick: Foolish Fool (Foolish Fool, 1969) Mercury Marvin Gaye & Tammi Terrell: You're All I Need to Get By (You're All I Need, 1968) Tamla/Motown Irene Scott: Everyday Worries (Everyday Worries 7", 196?) Midas Bob Azzam & His Orchestra: Rain, Rain, Go Away (New Sounds, 1968) Columbia Harvey Averne Dozen: You're No Good (Viva Soul, 1968) Atlantic The Spinners: It's a Shame (2nd Time Around, 1970) V.I.P. The Emotions: As Long as I've Got You [demo] (Songs of Innocence and Experience, 1972) Stax Fontella Bass: Hold On This Time (Free, 1972) Paula/Fuel John Ellison: You've Got to Have Rhythm (You've Got To Have Rhythm 7", 197?) Phil L.A. of Soul Charles Wright & the Watts 103rd St. Rhythm Band: Express Yourself [alternate version] (Puckey Puckey: Jams and Outtakes 1970-1971, 1970) Rhino Handmade Cablidos: Barrio Bueno (Crossfire, early 1970's) Schema Italy Junior Parker: Taxman (Love Ain't Nothin' But a Business Goin' On, 1971) Groove Merchant Eli "Paperboy" Reed & the True Loves: The Satisfier (Roll With You, 2008) Q-Division Duffy: Warwick Avenue (Rockferry, 2008) Mercury Menahan Street Band: The Traitor (Make the Road by Walking, 2008) Daptone The Budos Band: His Girl (The Budos Band II, 2007) Daptone
item.itunes:subtitle: Soul 102: starting off with big band, blitzing through jump blues, drifting through gospel before hitting some sweet soul music.

item.title: Broadcast on 25-Jul-2008
item.description:
Here's your soulful swaplist. Additional information will be posted on http://gak.ca in due course.
1. East of Underground: Poppin' Popcorn/Oye Como Va (East of Underground, 1971) U.S. Army/Wax Poetics 2. Chairmen of the Board: Give Me Just A Little More Time (Give Me Just A Little More Time, 1970) Invictus 3. Lee Moses: Time and Place (Time and Place, 1970) Maple 4. Allen Toussaint: Southern Nights (Southern Nights, 1975) Water 5. Joy Denalane: Soweto '76-'06 (Born & Raised, 2006) 6. Tommy Guerrero: Badder Than Bullets (From the Soil to the Soul, 2006) Quannum 7. O.V. Wright: A Nickel and a Nail (A Nickel And A Nail And Ace Of Spades, 1971) Backbeat 8. Wilson Pickett: I'm in Love (I'm in Love, 1968) Atlantic 9. Charles Wright & the Watts 103rd Street Rhythm Band: Fried Okra [Mono] (Hot Heat and Sweet Groove, 1967) Warner Bros. 10. Charles Bradley & the Menahan Street Band: The World (is Going Up in Flames) (Daptone 7" Singles Collection, Vol. 2, 2008) Daptone 11. Lee Fields: Could Have Been (Daptone 7" Singles Collection, Vol. 2, 2008) Daptone 12. Irene Kral: Going to California (Gilles Peterson Digs America 2, 2007) Luv N'Haight 13. Marvin Holmes & the Uptights: Oomph (Oomph 7", 1967) Spotlight 14. Sticks of Dynamite: It's Football, Baby (It's Football Baby 7", 1968?) Saxton 15. The Intruders: Together (Together 7", 1967) Gamble 16. Sly, Slick & Wicked: Sho' Nuff (Sho' Nuff single, 1973) People 17. Daryl Hall & John Oates: She's Gone (Abandoned Luncheonette, 1973) Atlantic 18. Rufus & Chaka Khan: You Got the Love (Rags to Rufus, 1974) ABC 19. Roberta Flack: Reverend Lee (Chapter 2, 1970) Atlantic 20. Irma Thomas: I Gave You Everything (A Woman Will Do Wrong 7", 1967) Chess 21. Bobby Taylor & the Vancouvers: If You Love Her (I Am Your Man 7", 1968) Gordy 22. Different Strokes: Sing a Simple Song (Sing a Simple Song 7", 1969) Okeh 23. Bobby Byrd: I'm Not to Blame (Bobby Byrd Got Soul, 1995) Polygram 24. Gnarls Barkley: Who's Gonna Save My Soul (The Odd Couple, 2008) Atlantic 25. Denise LaSalle: A Love Reputation (Northern Soul, 2005) Chess 26. The Alyn Ainsworth Orchestra: Cast Your Fate to the Wind (Big City Soul, 1975) Pye

item.title: Broadcast on 20-Jun-2008
item.description:
Jason's out this week, so that GAK guy's filling in. Here's your playlist to being your summer.
1. DJ Shadow: This Time (I'm Gonna Try It My Way) (The Outsider, 2006) Universal 2. Mighty Walker Brothers: God Been Good To Me (Good God! A Gospel Funk Hymnal, 2008) Numero Group 3. Al Green: You've Got the Love I Need (featuring Anthony Hamilton) (Lay It Down, 2008) Bluenote 4. Buena Vistas: Here Come Da Judge (Here Come Da Judge, 1968) Marquee 5. Rodger Collins: Foxy Girls in Oakland (Bay Area Funk, 2004) Ubiquity 6. Alan Moorhouse: Soul Skimmer (Exclusive Blend Volume 2, 1997) Blow Up 7. Ronnie Keaton: Going Down for the Last Time (Keb Darge's Legendary Deep Funk, 1997) Barely Breaking Even 8. Otis Redding and Carla Thomas: Knock On Wood (King & Queen, 1967) Stax 9. Cyril Neville: Tell Me What's On Your Mind (New Orleans Funk, 2008) Soul Jazz 10. Freddie Scott: (You) Got What I Need (7", 1968) Shout 11. Pleasure Web: Music Man Pt. 1 and 2 (7", 1973) Eastbound 12. Dynamic Tints & Pieces Of Peace: Be My Lady (Eccentric Soul: Twinight's Lunar Rotation, 2007) Numero Group 13. Stephanie McKay: Tell It Like It Is (Stephanic McKay EP, 2006) Astralwerks 14. Soul Vibrations: The Dump (Funky 16 Corners, 2001) Stones Throw 15. Okie Duke: Ain't No Colour to Soul (Chicken Lickin', 1968?) Ovation 16. The Impressions: We're A Winner (We're A Winner, 1968) Universal 17. Curtis Mayfield: Give Me Your Love (Love Song) (Super Fly OST, 1972) Curtom 18. Bill Withers: Who Is He (and What is He to You?) (Still Bill, 1972) Sussex 19. Linda Lyndell: What A Man (Soul Sides: Volume One, 2005) Zealous 20. Eugene McDaniels: Cherrystones (Outlaw, 1970) Atlantic 21. Eddie & Ernie: We Try Harder (I Believe She Will 7", 1966) Shazam/Chess 22. The Five Du-Tones: Monkee See Monkey Do (Shake a Tail Feather, 1963) One-Derful 23. Gil Scott-Heron & Brian Jackson: The Bottle (Winter in America, 1973) TVT 24. Isaac Hayes: Pursuit of the Pimpmobile (Truck Turner OST, 1974) Enterprise 25. Isaac Hayes: Main Title "Truck Turner" (Truck Turner OST, 1974) Enterprise 26. Isaac Hayes: House of Beauty (Truck Turner OST, 1974) Enterprise 27. Isaac Hayes: Blue's Crib (Truck Turner OST, 1974) Enterprise 28. The Backyard Heavies: Expo 83 (Soul Junction 7", 1971) Specter
item.itunes:subtitle: gak fills for Jason, providing you with nice funk, soul and R&B to start your summer. Al Green's here, along with Bill Withers, Gil Scott-Heron and Otis Redding. Music from the films Jackie Brown, Super Fly and Truck Turner.
